Message.Title: The science of profiling
Message.Msg: It is no longer acceptable to target the most likely perps, even though everyone else in the world uses profiling in many cases with no undue problems for the citizenry. Ghosananon asks: "Well, they were black males. In fact, 8 recent robberies in that very neighborhood were all perped by black males per police reports. Can we not dare voice facts anymore? Orwell must be rejoicing at his prescience." I have been on private planes that went through customs, arriving from drug producing centers, where nothing was unloaded, the agents simply profiled us. We profile inanimate objects every day. Shoes and liquids at airports are suspect, while 85 year old grandmas are frisked to be fair. PSA's at airports tell us to watch for "suspicious" activity, which is profiling itself. As long as one is acting within the law, it's legal for one to pace, sweat, repeatedly check the time, etc. We are kidding ourselves that police don't profile daily. Someone should try a test with a red Porsche and a white 10 year old crown Vic running the same roadway speeding the same amount and see which gets the most tickets over time. Same experiment in the far left lane in a multi lane highway and inner lanes, you'll get far more tickets in the left lane going the same speed because police TARGET that lane because that's where speeders usually are. Until we stop kidding ourselves we are going to make little progress.

Topic.Title: someone in talks to buy primesense for $280 mio.?

Message.Msg: I'd hate to see that happen, because the effect would be much the same as if Microsoft were to buy Primesense. The basic software associated with the Primesense device has been Open Source, freely available to developers; we could expect that to change if the company were acquired, and and that would seriously limit the future potential of the hardware.

Message.Title: Here’s Where Google Is Eating Deep into Microsoft’s Share
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: "Google Inc’s. (NASDAQ:GOOG) paid enterprise business is starting to seriously pick up across Asia, as companies such as India’s Madras Cements, South Korea’s Posco, and Japan’s ANA Holdings Inc. incorporate Google software into their businesses. "In a market where Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) still dominates, Google is experiencing a boom, as Asian businesses adopt business-tailored versions of software such as Gmail, Google Maps, and other applications. Head of Enterprise at Google, Amit Singh, declined to detail specific figures, but told the Wall Street Journal that the business software adoption is happening much faster in Asia than in their American counterparts. " “Asian companies don’t have as much legacy to worry about,” Singh said. “There’s less to overcome and less to migrate over” when switching to Google tools from traditional business software. "Google enterprise tools also allow business software to be used on a variety of devices, and that is particularly important in Asia, where many access the Internet primarily through mobile devices, hampered by poor landline infrastructure, according to Singh." _________________________________ But it is happening in American businesses also, even though not as fast. This is Microsoft's heart of hearts, and Google is gnawing away at it.

Message.Title: Industry Consolidation to Make this Stock Takeover Target
Message.Msg: A huge wave of consolidation is beginning to take place in the cable TV industry with many cable TV operators the subject of M&A rumors. During the last wave of cable TV industry consolidation in 2006 the operators were the initial stocks to run, but afterwards the focus shifted to cable TV tech vendors. Seachange (SEAC) was the subject of a Brean Capital analyst research note this past December that said "Because of SEAC's leading position in key areas of MSO investment, it is not likely to remain an independent company in an industry consolidation scenario." SEAC has been rallying big in recent days, now that a wave of industry consolidation is here, soaring past its 52-week high of $12.10 on Monday and setting a new 52-week high yesterday of $12.50 where it trades with an enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.89. Back in 2006, SEAC was also the subject of takeover rumors - but in every article written about SEAC in 2006, its rival CCUR was mentioned as a potential takeover target as well. Since then, CCUR has actually surpassed SEAC to capture the #1 largest video on demand (VOD) technology market share, and CCUR also leads in other key areas like start-over/look-back, and Big Data Analytics. CCUR hasn't received any analyst research notes in recent months like SEAC, but if you look at the reasons Brean calls SEAC a takeover target - CCUR fits all of the same criteria, and CCUR is extremely undervalued vs. SEAC, with CCUR currently trading with an enterprise value/revenue ratio of only 0.71. For CCUR just to match SEAC's current enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.89, CCUR needs to rise to $16.21. Look for CCUR to explode in the weeks ahead, and for CCUR to surpass SEAC's share price next month. CCUR's 10-K filing is due out next month and CCUR's annual non-GAAP EPS could potentially reach $0.50, exceeding SEAC's current non-GAAP EPS of $0.44. CCUR recently raised its dividend by 100%, and now pays a huge dividend yield of 6.2%, the highest in the industry!

When it was sitting there like a ripe peach at under $15 for so long and he could have gotten it for about half of what he offered a couple of years before, (and it still owned 43% of Alibaba now worth about $40 bil. ) he then wanted no part. Could have merged w/ Bing and MS net and had them make money now rather than continue to be a drag. B Gates was the brains, Ballmer is just a loud mouth and idiot.

Topic.Title: Windows 8 is a disgrace

Message.Msg: Go dig for the auto update stuff and turn it off. Yes I had the same problem never ending updates for everything. I also deled the junk ware that came with my computer which was also trying to update all the time. Wiped out a bunch of tiles I'll never use. Went with Open office instead of MS office. I added a start button menu with an add on and a pop server program. . All this cut down on my swearing at the computer.
